place.name: STIXWOULD
place.gazetteerText: STIXWOULD, a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; on the river Witham and the Great Northern railway, 5¾ miles NNW of Tattershall. It has a station on the railway, and a post-office under Horncastle. Acres, 2,250. Real property, £3,023. Pop., 269-Houses, 48. The property is divided among a few. A Cistertian nunnery was founded here, in the time of Stephen, by the Earl of Chester; and went, at the dissolution, to R. Dighton. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £105* Patron,Turner, Esq. The church was rebuilt in 1831. There is a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
